column1: axl99 155732752199 "2017-01-11 21:29:44 GMT" https://axl99.tumblr.com/post/155732752199/deathlydelicious-ok-guys-we-need-to-talk-about "deathlydelicious: Ok guys
column2: we need to talk about J.C.Leyedecker
column3: and how its a fucking travesty that no one has made a film about him yet. So Leyendecker was an illustrator during the 1910‚Ä≤s-1940‚Ä≤s. His work was absolutely gorgeous and highly ubiquitous at the time
column4: and his llustrations for the Arrow shirt company created one of the most iconic images of male beauty of the early 20th century. But this icon came with a delicously romantic twist. So this image of The Arrow Man was both incredibly macho and well built
column5: but also ethereally pretty and dapper. But the model who the drawing was based on cropped up in A LOT of Leyendeckers work. In many he was engaged in casual social scenes with other men
column6: in others he was shaving in the bathroom or getting dressed
column9: dark blond hair perfectly in place
column10: jaw sharp as a fucking shovel
column11: but with a slightly rounded chin. In one ad for war bonds he even appeared as the statue of liberty. This same man appeared in hundrereds of drawings
column12: each with the same sharp care and attention to detail which makes looking at him almost feel voyeristic.¬† So this mans image is EVERYWHERE during the early 20th century
column13: and he is a fashion/lifestyle icon for men on par with the female gibson girl. He was the celebrated symbol of male strength
column15: and power.¬† And man who modeled for Leyendecker‚Äôs iconic univerally adored macho man? That would be his lover
column16: Charles Beach. ¬† so all this gorgeously homoerotic artwork defined the image of hyper macho masculinity during the interwar period. Leyendecker painted Beach onto the face of the world
column17: that was his love letter. He basically immortalised the love of his life by making the whole world adore him as much as he did.   Leyendecker‚Äôs¬†work would go on to influence the likes of F. Scott Fitzgerald and Norman Rockwell. After his death in 1951
column18: when people figured out that the unmarried man he‚Äôd been drawing and living with for decades
column19: right up until the time of his death
column21: Leyendecker‚Äôs name has sadly been pushed out of the history books in favour of more wholesome characters. And that fucking sucks I would like to request a full length movie
column22: with all the jazz era glamour and steamy romance that this genius deserved. During a time when homosexual men where thought of as weak deviants
column23: this man not only had the nerve to use his lover as the model for all his great works
column24: but he made him into the STANDARD of what it was to be a man.¬† J.C. Leyendecker and Charles Beach deserve your rememberance.¬†   ‚Ä¶. Didn‚Äôt Charles Beach threaten to out Leyendecker when the latter wanted to break it off?And Norman Rockwell apparently hated Beach and frequently disrespected Leyendecker in his biography.I mean‚Ä¶ this is fodder material from relatively anecdotal sources that can make great drama for a film on paper‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt trust filmmakers in exercising proper due diligence in making sure these complex relationships are presented respectfully. And also this sort of changes my attitude towards the artists I have been taught to respect and admire." False text

column1: axl99 148485526279 "2016-08-05 06:43:36 GMT" https://axl99.tumblr.com/post/148485526279/a-friend-won-tickets-to-see-suicide-squad-and-i "A friend won tickets to see Suicide Squad and I came with.It was fun and then it was abysmal. The world was brought back from the brink of destruction but there was absolutely no saving of the circular plot.And then the after credits scene made me look sorta look forward to another DC movie.¬†Jared‚Äôs performance wasn‚Äôt all that great to watch. It was boring. You may as well give him cat ears and let him cosplay as a cat who took a mighty hit of the nip and made out with buckets of paint before making biscuits all over your tummy.Margot Robbie owned her role as well as she could with the shoddy material she was given. She had one genuine moment near the end of the film where everything hinged on her acting and she pulled it off pretty flawlessly.Will Smith? He was a tiny ray of light that occasionally makes jokes about white people and how his profession translates into junior high math.Also it was shot in Toronto. So I felt the homesickness deep in my soul.I wanted to have fun with this film
column2: I really wanted to‚Ä¶.But it was free so‚Ä¶.¬†" True text

column2: if you visit a certain website a lot the price will increase. You can tell if that‚Äôs the case by checking the same web page on a different browser if you have a different number of stored cookies for that site. I checked something on Chegg and it was $14.95 on Chrome
column4: and $16.95 on Safari. The fix? Clear your cookies for that website. Reblog
column5: save a wallet.  Plane tickets almost always do this!  PLANE TICKETS DO THIS ALL THE DAMN TIME¬† When you‚Äôre looking for plane tickets and waiting for prices to drop
column6: ALWAYS clear your cookies beforehand and switch between browsers. A friend of mine was looking for a flight and getting prices that were the CHEAPEST at $800-1000
column7: I sent her a link for a round trip that was like $495
column8: and it read as $900 on her computer because she had been hounding the airline site.¬†  alternatively: avoid all this headache by using incognito when shopping for plane tickets
column10: etc  FML. I JUST bought tickets too.." False text

axl99 145232306739 "2016-06-01 01:11:39 GMT" https://axl99.tumblr.com/post/145232306739/poi-psa "axl99:  Speaking as someone in the POI fandom who survived If-Then-Else followed by 3 weeks of absolutely soul crushing torture because CBS is fucking with the airing schedule of season 4‚Ä≤s mid season finale eps and on
column2: and then waited well over a year with the rest of the fandom for season 5 that got chopped in half from 22-23 eps to 13 because CBS is a salty white conservative piece of BS that got absolutely trolled by the evil geniuses behind Person of Interest: New fans. Welcome to The Machine. We would really like to start off the last 13 eps of our favourite show with a lot more enthusiasm and excitement because the writers and cast and crew and stunt coordinators worked their damn asses off shooting in an expensive location like New York on an extremely limited budget in summer and winter.¬† If anyone here wants to work in tv or film
column3: these guys are literally the best in the business and you should totally learn from them. Case in point: Sarah Shahi shot season 4 while she was pregnant and kept going as far as it was medically safe for her to continue doing so
column6: hit the gym a few months later and whipped her ass back in even better shape for her role on the show. Then shot everything
column8: over the next few months and went on Nancy Drew cause the woman is a goddamn workaholic and can also balance her home life with 3 kids. The show is full of talent like this. The writers are also ridiculously smart people who have been subverting tropes left and right from day one. We have archives of deconstructive meta from our talented fandom here to prove it.   There‚Äôs only a few weeks left. Season 5 is going to be awesome no matter what anyone‚Äôs going to say because all the characters and their arcs are treated with the utmost respect in relation to the bigger plot. Everyone is extremely invested in making a story that works and doesn‚Äôt need to resort to cheap shock tactics for narrative purposes. Give POI a thorough rewatch from season 1
column9: right after you binge through it the first time. There‚Äôs a lot of really interesting stuff about every character and how they relate and interact with each other that you might have missed because you might not have cared about them initially. It‚Äôs an awesome way to pass the time and enjoy the show in a different way. Guaranteed. So please. Have a little faith. And trust in The Machine.  ALSO‚Ä¶.CHILL." False text
